summary: Key findings on BOJ rate hike probability before May 1 2026
content:
Key findings:

1. BOJ held rates at 0.75% at Jan 22-23 meeting (as expected by all 52 Bloomberg-surveyed economists)
2. Reuters poll (Jan 15): 97% of 67 economists expect NO change at January AND March meetings
3. July seen as most likely timing for next hike (not March/April)
4. BUT: CNBC Jan 16 report says "BOJ sources see scope to raise rates sooner than markets expect, with April a distinct possibility" due to sliding yen adding inflationary pressure
5. Citigroup sees risk of April hike if dollar rises above Â¥160 (currently ~152.45)
6. State Street: base case one hike in 2026, but if yen breaches 160 could see April hike
7. ING: expects October as most likely timing for next hike
8. Japan snap election Feb 8 2026 - political uncertainty adds caution
9. BOJ April 27-28 meeting is a critical date - follows spring wage negotiations and BOJ business survey (April 1)
10. BOJ March meeting also scheduled before May 1

Meeting schedule in window (Jan 22 - May 1):
- March meeting (likely mid-March)
- April 27-28 meeting

Key factors:
- Consensus: hold through March, possibly hike in April but more likely July
- Yen at 152.45 - below the 160 threshold that would trigger early hike
- Spring wage negotiations results will be key data
- Political uncertainty from snap election
- BOJ sources hint at April possibility
